definition: to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

sentences.english: Sheila worked like a dog to complete the book report on time.
sentences.chinese: 席拉为求准时完成读书报告而拼命赶工。
蜜蜂嗡嗡叫，忙着去赶工。

sentences.english: Due to a breakdown. The production team played catch up all week.
sentences.chinese: 由于机器故障，生产组整个星期都在拼命赶工。

sentences.english: Sorry I'm so out of it, had to pull an all-nighter last night!
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我有点迷迷糊糊，昨晚一夜赶工没有睡。

definition: without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
time allocated for a project/completion date
to finish work/to complete a project
to intensify/to speed up/to step up
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom)/jerry-building/sloppy work
to repair in a rush/rush repairs
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to accelerate at full power (idiom); at full speed/fig. to work as hard as possible
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
